About Me

Let me tell you a few things...

BIO

Currently I am a student at the University of Waterloo in Mechatronics Engineering. I have a strong passion for engineering; particularly robotics, energy, automation, aerospace, and most related industries. Personally, I am most interested in embedded systems, firmware, hardware, electronics, modelling and data engineering. In my spare time, I enjoy hiking mountains, sports like mixed martial arts, basketball, and volleyball; along with simple sketch drawing, non-fiction books, and new experiences.

Geotab

Applications Engineering Developer Co-op

September - December 2019

Primarily worked along side the technical project manager to assit with technical work around a new product at the company. Worked primariliy revolved around reversing engineering circuit boards, hardware development, PCB design, firmware testing, bench testing, spectral analysis, and rapid prototyping.

Highlights

  • Firmware development and testing of bluetooth heartbeat state machine, device sleep state and switch IC commands using embedded tools such as S32 design studio and Keil uVision IDEs.
  • Designed a custom PCB using Altium for testing hardware peripherals such as CAN communication using active high pass filters, relay control, GPIO and low side drive functionality.
  • Validation testing of internal hardware and firmware through custom build bench testing setups, reading UART communication with PuTTY, embedded tools debugging and utilizing tools such as an spectrum analyzer.
  • Engaged in rapid prototyping using a bluetooth module and arduino to control a reverse engineered OEM PCB board with external circuitry through bluetooth commands.
  • Developed a prototype concept for a streamlined PCB to utilize switch ICs and bluetooth to control RFID, RF signals and power to a reversed engineered OEM PCB.

University of Waterloo

Research Assitant | Center for Advanced Materials Joining

January - April 2019

Technical assitant aiding a PhD and Masters student with their studies focused on liquid metal embrittlement in high strength steels (HSS). Responsibilities invovled data analysis, machining, CAD design, PLC programming of robotic welding arm and helped Co-Author a research paper.

Highlights

  • Experience with operating and using PLC for a production robotic spot welder.
  • Collected data on steel cracking and used Excel and Matlab to perform data analysis, such as regression, distribution and examine results.
  • Designed custom jigs, fittings and equipment using Solidworks along with machining the parts on a lathe and mill.
  • Collected data and assited with Co-Authoring a research paper on the role of spot weld electrode geometry on liquid metal embrittlement crack development.

UWAFT | Univeristy of Waterloo EcoCar Team

Electrical Engineering Team Lead

September 2018 - Present

This student team participates in a four-year competition to covert a stock Chevrolet Blazer into a hybrid electric vehicle with autonomous features. My current role involves facilitating the development of the entire High Voltage and Low Voltage systems in the vehicle, highlights include.

Highlights

  • Firmware development and testing of bluetooth heartbeat state machine, device sleep state and switch IC commands using embedded tools such as S32 design studio and Keil uVision IDEs.
  • Designed a custom PCB using Altium for testing hardware peripherals such as CAN communication using active high pass filters, relay control, GPIO and low side drive functionality.
  • Validation testing of internal hardware and firmware through custom build bench testing setups, reading UART communication with PuTTY, embedded tools debugging and utilizing tools such as an spectrum analyzer.
  • Engaged in rapid prototyping using a bluetooth module and arduino to control a reverse engineered OEM PCB board with external circuitry through bluetooth commands.
  • Developed a prototype concept for a streamlined PCB to utilize switch ICs and bluetooth to control RFID, RF signals and power to a reversed engineered OEM PCB.
